content: simple fair isle hat by asny a handknit design designed and made by asny this pattern is for personal use do not reproduce or sell this pattern if you wish to sell finished physical items please contact me for approval *disclaimer this pattern is free and thus is quite brief i do not go into details here this is not a pattern that teaches you how to knit this pattern tells you how i made my hat thank you for understanding * hat information for this hat i used two 100g balls of yarn one undyed and one hand dyed if you don t want to make the pompom or you´ll be using a faux fur one you might get away with only 100g of yarn the yarn i used was 100m 218 yards for 100g 100% merino i used 60cm 24-inch circular needles size 5 5mm us 9 additionally i used scissors and a darning needle my gauge was approximately 15stitches x 22rows for 10x10cm 4x4inch the hat size overall 22cm wide x 24xm long additional information this hat is worked in round from the bottom up with the pompom added last the hat is quite long if you want to you can make it shorter by starting the colorwork earlier if you want to you can use a pompom maker or diy it you can find videos on youtube i make my pompoms by simply wrapping them around my palm instead of using a pompom maker instructions below instructions to make it easier for me and for you the first colour that we will use will be called the main colour mc in the pattern that is the pink in the pictures and the second colour that we will use will be called the secondary colour single_crochet that is the white in the pictures using a long tail cast on cast on 64 stitches st if you want the hat smaller cast on 56st if bigger cast on 72st row 1-12 knit 1st purl 1st repeat for the rest of the round row 13-23 knit every stitch we now introduce the second colour row 24 knit 3st in mc knit 1st in single_crochet repeat for the rest of the round row 25 knit all stitches in mc row 26 knit 1st in mc knit 1st in single_crochet knit 2st in mc repeat for the rest of the round row 27 knit 3st in mc knit 1st in single_crochet repeat for the rest of the round row 28 knit 1st in single_crochet knit 1st in mc repeat for the rest of the round row 29 knit 1st in mc knit 1st in single_crochet repeat for the rest of the round row 30 knit 1st in single_crochet knit 1st in mc repeat for the rest of the round row 31 knit 2st in single_crochet knit 1st in mc knit 1st in single_crochet repeat for the rest of the round row 32 knit 1st in mc knit 3st in single_crochet repeat
